featuredShowsList.showText: Indiana co-directed (October 2023) a night of new writing 'Burnt at the Stake, or The Whole of the Truth' at Shakespeare’s Globe. 13 anonymous writers told the tales that needed to be told in a night of uncensored and fearless storytelling. This was a night for us all to celebrate the power of story and imagination to make positive change.
featuredShowsList.showImageAlt: A production shot of Burnt at the Stake. 3 actors who played witches in the production in an orange palette of burnt clothing in an orange holding hands.

featuredShowsList.showText: Indiana was Resident Associate Director at Shakespeare's Globe in 2023. Her role included working as associate on 'A Midsummer Night's Dream' directed by Elle While (starring Michelle Terry) and 'As You Like It' directed by Ellen McDougall . As Resident Associate, Indiana was an integral part of the creative team from the early development of the productions and a part of the core artistic team within Shakespeare’s Globe throughout the year.
featuredShowsList.showImageAlt: A Midsummer Night's Dream poster featuring Michelle Terry as Puck with leaves and flowers in her hair.

featuredShowsList.showText: A new piece of writing, written by Ant Stones and devised and directed by Indiana. The script focused on seizure awareness through a modern fairytale with the use of forum theatre. The show toured throughout Surrey over a three week run. It was an incredibly rewarding process where we witnessed the impact theatre can have on highlighting unheard voices and a production giving life tools that could save lives.
featuredShowsList.showImageAlt: Cartoon of princess inviting you to join her on the modern day train

currentWorkList.currentWorkTitle: Pinocchio by Michael Morpurgo, adapted by Simon Reade
currentWorkList.currentWorkText: Indiana Lown-Collins and Elle While (Co-Directors) brought Simon Reade’s adaptation of Michael Morpurgo’s artfully told, funny and anarchic story of our favourite puppet boy Pinocchio to life, at The Watermill Theatre (Christmas 2024). This production was named one of the 'Top 10 shows of 2024' by the Guardian. Audiences joined us on an adventure into a magical world where things weren't always what they seemed.

currentWorkList.currentWorkText: Indiana's JMK Award winning production 'The Solid Life Of Sugar Water' by Jack Thorne played to universal critical claim at The Orange Tree Theatre in Richmond, autumn 2022. 'The Solid Life of Sugar Water' is a beautifully told, witty and impassioned personal story. It amplifies disabled voices as an integral part of the play, and provides representation of a community that often goes unseen and unheard.

otherCredits: As associate director: The Comedy of Errors and A Comedy of Rascals (Yvonne Arnaud Theatre); Drop the Dead Donkey (U.K. tour, Simon Friend Productions); Richard III, As You Like It and A Midsummer Night’s Dream (Shakespeare’s Globe); The Light at the Piazza in concert (Alexandra Palace Theatre); Macbeth (Guildford Shakespeare Company); Merrily We Roll Along (Yvonne Arnaud Theatre) and The Woman in White (Electric Theatre). As Assistant Director: Titus Andronicus and Julius Caesar (Shakespeare’s Globe); All’s Well That Ends Well (Jermyn Street Theatre); Cinderella (Yvonne Arnaud); All Aboard (Electric Theatre). As Movement Director: The Comedy of Errors and A Comedy of Rascals (Yvonne Arnaud Theatre); Romeo and Juliet, Henry V and The Tales of Hans Christian Andersen (GSC). Indiana was Resident Associate Director at Shakespeare's Globe (2023) and Resident Assistant Director and Producer at the Guildford Shakespeare Company (2019–2021), where she assisted on As You Like It,  She Stoops to Conquer, The Merry Wives of Windsor, Twelfth Night, Robin Hood, Alice in Wonderland, Romeo and Juliet and The Legend of King Arthur.
directorCredits: Pinocchio (The Watermill Theatre); Burnt at the Stake (Shakespeare’s Globe); The Solid Life of Sugar Water (Orange Tree Theatre); Romeo and Juliet and The Purple Princess (Guildford Shakespeare Company); and The Last Supper for the Fresh Direction ‘Replay Project’ at the Young Vic.
aboutMeText: Indiana (she/her), is a Theatre Maker and Director who won the 2022 JMK Directors Award with her production of, ‘The Solid Life of Sugar Water’ by Jack Thorne, which played to universal critical acclaim at the Orange Tree Theatre and won the OFFIE for 'Best Production'. She was then nominated for ‘Best Debut Director’ at ‘The Stage Debut Awards’. Indiana is an Associate Artist at Shakespeare’s Globe and Orange Tree Theatre. Indiana has worked in a number of different and exciting venues such as Leeds Playhouse, Watermill Theatre, The Young Vic, Shakespeare’s Globe and The Orange Tree Theatre. Her latest production ‘Pinocchio’ which played at the Watermill Theatre was named one of the ‘Guardian’s top 10 shows of 2024’. As an artist Indiana thrives to push boundaries; prioritising working with an uninhibited perspective and making theatre that will evolve her artistic practice towards discovering radical yet sincere forms of expression. As a disabled artist she is passionate about making theatre that puts disabled voices at the centre of the story. Indiana loves to make work that takes our senses to their extreme, celebrating theatricality and it’s craft with use of movement, playing with form and a great emphasis on language, it’s sounds and the thrilling ways it can travel.
